attributes.action: Make Laser Eye Surgery available as a free NHS service for all eye conditions.
attributes.background: For those people who where glasses and those who do not, as a 20 year old, I struggle with the prospect of knowing that I will have to see the greatest years and future years of my life behind glass, as I am unable to afford the treatment myself.
attributes.additional_details:
Laser eye surgery is available on the NHS for eye conditions that, without treatment, can lead to loss of vision. However, it’s not available for conditions that can be treated successfully in other ways, such as refractive (focusing) errors. 

The reasons for this are that the effect is life changing for the person receiving the treatment. The current means of correcting refractive errors, glasses, are not for everyone.

attributes.action: Allow NHS staff of 15+ years to retire early. At the age of 55.
attributes.background: Allow NHS staff who have worked for the service for 15+ years to retire early with a full pension at the age of 55. This is for their dedication to to the service and time that they have missed with family members over the years whilst caring for others family members.

attributes.action: Stop risking our lives and health. Set up a royal commission to reform the NHS.
attributes.background: I am a retired medical doctor and have seen standards in health care deteriorate over several decades. My own experience and that of family and friends have reinforced that view. It is time to do something positive.
attributes.additional_details: Letter to The Sunday Times November 20, 2016 by over 60 consultants calling for a royal commission to cure the NHS. Leading article in the same issue by Sarah-Kate Templeton: 'We must think the unpalatable to stop death of NHS say doctors'. Owen Paterson's report in October 2016 comparing the UK's NHS with other systems in the West. It found that 46,000 people died unnecessarily each year because of failings in our health service.

attributes.action: Introduce 2 part practical driving test, with the inclusion of a motorway test.
attributes.background:
Motorists lack of knowledge of the Highway Code is creating a culture of dangerous driving, which is likely to be the cause of many accidents.

I would like to see the current driving test revised to introduce a new 
2nd part that tests a motorists practical competence of motorway driving.
attributes.additional_details:
A learner driver is prohibited from using a motorway, and their first use of a motorway will only be after they have passed their driving test. Drivers need to be tested on their practical competence and application of the rules before being allowed on motorways alone. 

On a daily basis I witness motorist's breaching rules 264, 267 & 268 of the Highway Code which cover lane discipline and overtaking. DoT report of road traffic accidents shows an increase of people killed or seriously injured.

attributes.action: Introduce "tax free allowance" after working 37.5 hours or more per week
attributes.background: Every year, thousands of hard working people work 50/60 hour weeks to supplement their pay and are taxed to high heaven. If someone works hard, should they have their reward taken from them? People should not be taxed for working extra.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to do under the speed limit (when there's no traffic)
attributes.background: It's illegal to do over the speed limit because you could crash and/or kill someone BUT people doing under the speed limit can be just as bad.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been lots of times when people have been doing the speed limit and had to brake hard because a learner or unconfident driver is doing half or under half the speed limit.

AND times when people do the national speed limit on country roads and they come around a corner to find someone doing 20mph. It's not safe.

It also causes traffic and delays on the roads

attributes.action: Introduce CPR and Basic First Aid to the driving test
attributes.background: CPR as well as basic first aid should be a requirement to pass a uk driving test as driving can be a dangerous thing and you never know when you may need to use those skills, which in turn could potentially save someones life

attributes.action: Censor the broadcast of sexually explicit music to protect young children
attributes.background: I am petitioning the British Government to consider censoring the broadcast of sexually explicit music during the day to protect young listeners / viewers.
attributes.additional_details:
I've heard young children singing along to lyrics which are highly sexually suggestive. 

Over the last decade music has become increasingly sexualised and continues to evade existing censorship legislation / regulation.

attributes.action: Ban schools from giving out detention!
attributes.background:
Children are feeling more depressed and upset after having detention. What gives schools the right to keep our children behind after school. It teaches them absolutely nothing!.
This is going against our human rights. Holding us in a place of solitude and opression!
attributes.additional_details:
My child has never been given a detention before and she is very shy and scared of most things. she gets upset over little things. Last night she was given detention and came home really upset. she is now refusing to go school.
My friends son also was given a detention for 'coughing too many time' as the teacher thought he was messing around. however he just had a cold. he now never speaks to that teacher ever and hates her

attributes.action: Treat all purchases of drones in the same way as firearms
attributes.background:
DRONES are a serious threat to our security 
DRONES currently drop packages into our prisons.
DRONES were the cause of 23 near misses April-October 2015
DRONES hover over private homes, schools and parks
attributes.additional_details:
A former RAF and British Airways pilot warned that a drone hitting an airliner could result in an uncontrolled engine failure or a smashed cockpit windscreen.

A flight safety specialist insisted the large amount of data available is not a true representation of what would happen with a drone because "birds don't have a big lump of lithium battery in them".

The UK Airprox Board (UKAB) has published reports on the incidents, which took place between April 11 and October 4 last year.

attributes.action: Oblige all licensed premises to accept Pass Cards as ID and proof of age
attributes.background: Some premises allow Pass Cards to be used as ID, but some pubs and clubs don't allow them and claim they are fake. It is a legit form of identification. Every licensed premise that requires some form of ID to enter should allow Pass Cards just as it allows passports and driving licenses.
attributes.additional_details:
For example I went to a pub with a few friends for a birthday, the bouncer asked where I got it from. I said it’s from the challenge 25 website which has multiple different pass cards and it is a legitimate form of ID. He said nope that is fake, I can get that from ebay or somewhere else online. 

For more information see: http://www.pass-scheme.org.uk/

attributes.action: Charge bus pass users 50p per single trip equating to £1 per return journey.
attributes.background: My husband and I are both pensioners but are not, by any means, "wealthy". Like most pensioners we appreciate a free bus pass but feel that a minimal charge each time we travel is not going to cause hardship. The money generated by this small charge could go towards desperate road repairs locally.

attributes.action: Please, Contract BAE to develop a Harrier III.
attributes.background: The Harrier was the ONLY V/STOL jet IN THE WORLD. Instead of capitalising on a technological monopoly, the British Government sold the country out and our industry out to the Americans. Now we buy their exorbitant £100+ Million a piece F-35 STOVL jet with a program cost of $1.5 Trillion. Shameful.
attributes.additional_details: The cost to develop a Harrier III from the Harrier II, I am absolutely certain, would have been a fraction of the disastrous, bug ridden JSF program. The Unit cost too, I am certain, would have been been fractional. It's a matter of national pride too. What do we have left that we can be proud of? Concorde? Harrier? The world wanted these things. But no. Scrap it and buy American or EU... 'REDUCE F-35 ORDER AND REINVEST THE REMAINING *Billions* INTO A SYMBOL OF NATIONAL PRIDE: The Harrier III'.

attributes.action: Start to pay off the UK's Debt.
attributes.background: We are all told as young people not to spend money which you don't have, so why should the UK government do it. It's not only getting bigger, but is effecting our NHS which should be run like the US government, to fix this tax the rich more, the poor shouldn't have to pay for the rich and vice versa

attributes.action: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws.
attributes.background: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws....
attributes.additional_details:
The Government of Sierra Leone cracks down heavily on peaceful protests. It has become illegal to protest the injustices in the country without a police clearance. This is contrary to democracy and free speech. We, the people, hardly ever get the police clearance to voice our concerns. When we do, our voices are highly censored. We face hot water canons, live ammunition and police batons if we dare to protest without a police clearance. 
The UK Government gives a significant amount of aid to the Sierra Leonean government on the basis of it practicing democratic principles. Denying us the right to protest is undemocratic in every aspect. Cutting aid funds until they revisit those provisions that suppress free speech will force them into a civil dialogue with the people they ought to serve.

attributes.action: Limit how much a Estate Agent can charge for a Credit Check for new tenants
attributes.background: Credit searches for new tenants costs the Estate Agent around £7 a search. Most new tenants have to pay the Estate Agent between £120 and £250 for this. It's hard enough trying to fund a house move without the EA taking a huge chunk. This fee needs capping at no more that £50pp

attributes.action: Change the rules give children detained by police at school access to legal aid
attributes.background: Call for change to access legal aid so children can get justice against the actions of the police working in co-ordination with local authorities to secretly wrongfully detain innocent children at school, revoking their rights & right to their parents and misusing their data without any wrongdoing.
attributes.additional_details: In the light of police action to pre-plan with local authorities to detain an innocent 12 old child at school, the consequences of the event and negative impact to the child’s future education and misuse of data which may affect the child’s future, the system needs to change. Currently there is no protection for innocent children, due to the unfair system the public authorities’ access public money to engage legal experts to defend their actions. Children’s rights matter, legal aid is required.

attributes.action: Make Business Studies, Life Skills and Politics mandatory at Secondary School.
attributes.background: In school there is no direct focus on skills that children need to truly succeed in life. Business Studies is taken an optional subject when really we should be teaching our children how to be entrepreneurial, this would help children gain essential critical thinking skills to help them grow.
attributes.additional_details: There is so much opportunity that is potentially being wasted by not equipping children with the skills and knowledge to get on in life. Children should have a knowledge of politics, business, how to get a mortgage. Children should know who the Prime Minister of this country is and how laws are made. If we want our country to be set up for success we should invest in our children as they will invest in the country themselves.

attributes.action: Include Aesthetic Impairment or "Ugliness" in The Equality Act 2010.
attributes.background: We call for “Aesthetic Impairment” to be added to The Equality Act (2010) by the UK government and for suffers to be awarded the same protection from discrimination as the other included groups.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people whom are aesthetically Impaired or “ugly” face discrimination and disadvantage on a daily basis. Many unattractive people can be left feeling ostracised and questioning their self-worth and it can also lead to the development of mental health issues. 

Whatever the nature or route cause of someone’s appearance, not everybody can conform with the image of what our society deems to be “attractive” and to judge someone based upon this is fundamentally wrong.

attributes.action: Stop stereotyping teenagers by making national citizen service compulsory
attributes.background: We are a group of teenagers who feel like we are stereotyped frequently, such as being followed in shops, being stopped and searched in groups, seen as criminals and thugs, this makes us feel on edge and ashamed to be called a teenager. We feel our aim will make society a better place, aged 16-18.
attributes.additional_details: Our research found that often terms used to describe teenagers were "hoodies, louts, heartless, evil, frightening, scum, monsters, inhumane and threatening."

attributes.action: Total life Ban if caught using hand held mobile phone
attributes.background: If caught using a hand held mobile phone for talking or texting you should be given a total life time ban from driving.

attributes.action: Repeal  the Health and Social Care Bill.
attributes.background: This bill has signed the death knell for the NHS as we knew it. It has allowed private companies to cherry pick via tender the most lucrative parts of the system. This can not be allowed to continue. The NHS should be there for all.

attributes.action: The prohibition of  vehicle drivers smoking whilst driving
attributes.background: Drivers concentration must be  affected by smoking whilst driving.Observation  over many years show drivers smoking are often  using one hand to control the vehicle- lighting up and extinguishing the cigarette  must further affects drivers concentration

attributes.action: Government should not allow pilots to work on Christmas day
attributes.background:
This is a petition to bring to attention pilots who fly thousands of miles away from their families on the most precious day of the year for many people! 

Help me petition government to put a ban to flying on Christmas day!
attributes.additional_details:
I am surrounded by pilots, many of whom complain about working in Christmas day. The banks shut, so why shouldn't pilots have a "pilot day"? 

I call on government to help pilots and their families spend their day together. 

If pilots are being forced to fly on Christmas day, their families should be rewarded with free flights and accommodation to enable the families to be together. 

Please call on government to make this a possibility!

attributes.action: Small business should not pay employer's NI for employees of state pension age
attributes.background: Employees or Self-Employed of state pension age do not pay NI contributions so why should Employers? I spoke to David Cameron about this and he was intending to look into it but this did not happen due to the EU referendum result

attributes.action: Negotiate a bespoke reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU
attributes.background: Now the UK voted to leave the EU we will lose the freedom of movement right. This will cease once we leave and will mean we have to apply for a visa to go to the EU on holiday as we are third country nationals. The EU has plans to introduce a £50 holiday visa for citizens of third countries.
attributes.additional_details: This £50 charge is quite expensive for a holiday visa and will deter people going abroad. The only option could be a reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU/EEA. This could mean that UK citizens can travel to the EU, for 180 days, for free. This however, is only possible if we allow all EU nationals coming to the UK the same agreements. We could also include reciprocal emergency healthcare in this visa agreement. This will make it easier for full single market access.

attributes.action: Put 5 pence on national Insurance contributions to fund our N.H.S.
attributes.background: Everyone can afford 5pence to save our N.HS dont sit there do something

attributes.action: Make all retail and commercial premises prominently display their street numbers
attributes.background: Most shops and commercial premises fail to display their street numbers at all, making it very difficult to find them by address. This adds to high street congestion, pollution and potential for accidents by distracted drivers. Prominently displaying their street number should be a legal requirement

attributes.action: Require manufacturers & suppliers to label reduction in size/volume of a product
attributes.background: Since the economic downturn in 2009, manufacturers & suppliers of food & other consumer goods such as washing liquids have been reducing the size or volume of products whilst maintaining the same selling price or increasing it. This results in the consumer paying more money for less goods.
attributes.additional_details: Often the reductions are so subtle, that a consumer is unaware that anything has changed. This practice is misleading & unfair & it is time that manufacturers & suppliers are required to clearly mark a reduction in size or volume. This practice has made the weekly shop much more expensive & by labelling the reduction in size, consumers will be better informed to look at alternative products that may offer better value for money. See examples in this Daily Mail article: https://goo.gl/0aUpQF

attributes.action: Introduce a TV License Discount for Full Time Students
attributes.background: This petition calls on the government to take advantage of the TV license freeze ending in March 2017 to introduce a reduced rate TV license for full time students living in single occupancy rooms. By introducing a reduced rate, more students would consider buying a license.
attributes.additional_details: Unlike a typical home where only one license is needed, students staying in halls of residence are required to purchase an individual license for their room. For example, if a hall has 8 rooms on it, each student is currently required to purchase their own license for just one room at full cost. This is a large amount of money and it is unfair to charge students so much more despite them being on limited budgets. By introducing a reduced rate for single rooms, more students would pay the fee.

attributes.action: Restrict private parking charges to reasonable amounts.
attributes.background: It is proposed that the government amend the Protection of Freedom Act 2014 to restrict the amount a private company can issue a parking charge to a fair and reasonable amount and no more than what the local council can issue a penalty notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Every day many parking charge notices are issued to vehicles parking on private land. Normally, the fee to cover the car is a reasonable nominal amount. However, for those that overstay the period the vehicle is covered or parking the car without any cover the charges are unreasonable and far more than the loss of business the proprietor suffers. 

The everyday person in the United Kingdom that uses parking facilities lawfully but from time to time cannot cover their car for entirely adequate reasons are suffering unreasonable financial burdens.

attributes.action: Have one NHS distribution centre and buying in bulk whilst making cheaper deals.
attributes.background: We need to have one NHS distribution centre sending all the medical equipment and medicines to each individual hospital. Buying in bulk,getting better and more controled deals. Stoping different hospitals paying different prices,hopefully saving millions. The NHS deserves a better deal,and so do we!

attributes.action: Allow heating in education to be on in all colder months through more funding
attributes.background: I myself am a student of 16 with asthma. Throught my whole time in education I , along with all my peers , have suffered through the lack of heating. Simply wrapping up warm doesn't work, as breathing in cold air causes illnesses , leading to absents. Please help change this.

attributes.action: If 20% of a workforce are claiming tax credits  no dividend to shareholders
attributes.background: Any Company  paying its workers so low that they are subsidizing their wages with tax credits, should be barred from paying a dividend. The taxpayer should not be propping up greedy bosses that should  be paying correct wages  to the workers not  to shareholders

attributes.action: Outlaw sale of electronics with firmware reflashing code that can be reflashed
attributes.background: For security, require electronic devices with "reflashable" or other alterable firmware to have the section of code that performs the reflashing, and one that correctly downloads the current reflashable firmware contents, stored in Read Only Memory that is electronically impossible to alter.
attributes.additional_details:
Cyber attacks against hardware have begun to take the form of reflashing attacks which modify the firmware of the targeted device.

If the device's capability to be reflashed can itself be removed or tampered with by reflashing, attack code can make itself undetectable and impossible to remove, requiring the entire electronic device to be thrown away.

The proposal would obstruct this form of attack as fixed unchangable code would exist allow reflashing and reporting of flash memory contents.

attributes.action: Stop live music venues being closed by house buyers who chose to live there.
attributes.background: Fewer venues are open for musicians to play in because of home owners who complain AFTER buying.  The venue is then closed. Buyers should sign an acknowledgment of the venue as part of the buying process.
attributes.additional_details: Musicians have few places left to play.  This will be to the detriment of our potentially rich live music future and will effect tourism and local culture.  When all music venues are gone, the same people who complained about noise will bemoan it's loss.

attributes.action: Save Kingfisher Ward and Scbu at Dorchester County Hospital!!
attributes.background: The facilities for the care of very small babies and children are due to be cut drastically. This will involve having to travel at least an hour to get the medical care needed. This is just quite frankly ridiculous!! Time in an emergency is one of the key factors in the best chances of survival.

attributes.action: Ban weapons using nanotechnology before they are able to be produced
attributes.background: Nanotechnology could be reality in the next few years and, while there are many benefits of this, the potential of nanotech weapons is too great a threat to humanity to be allowed, these weapons must be banned before they can be produced to prevent the devistation that could arise from their use

attributes.action: Give the HSE more powers under the law to regulate gas safety for consumers.
attributes.background: A recent Which? investigation showed that engineers failed to provide boiler servicing which is safe and meets minimum requirements for the job. Of the 6 'big companies' and 4 independent companies checked 70% failed to meet minimum legal requirements. The HSE need legal powers to be effective.
attributes.additional_details:
The Health & Safety Executive must be able to hold Gas Safe and it's engineers to account and ensure Gas Safe registered engineers:

1} are competent to complete a full, safe boiler service, with regular checks on performance

2} have a legal minimum boiler service time

3} complete a clear, detailed report

4} are held to account in the same way as other professions which potentially risk peoples lives

5} HSE should complete robust checks on standards of work & update the registration process.

attributes.action: Make the buying age of tobacco products 16+.
attributes.background:
The minimum age was 16 years of prior to 1994. 
Plus we can smoke at 16 but not buy it? this makes no sense and needs to be changed asap.

attributes.action: Pass legislation to abolish the payment of full council tax on probate property
attributes.background: It seems that councils are now charging 100% council tax on probate properties, irrespective of whether efforts are being made to sell or rent them. Legislation, it seems, will allow them to charge 150% or even 200% next year. This is immoral and unfair and nothing more than another unfair tax.

attributes.action: Close or take drastic measures to improve the 111 nhs service.
attributes.background: The NHS 111 service continually provide incorrect information and put people's lives at risk and put extra strain on the hospitals, doctors and the ambulance service. They also don't listen to what the problem is , they read a computer screen.

attributes.action: Require by law Landlords/Ladies to change mattresses between different tenants.
attributes.background: Hi. I'm just another student in the London renting market. Yep, that open sewer of real estate. Thanks to not being provided a new mattress when I moved in to a property, I have had both fleas and bedbugs. I am asking that the government require new mattresses for new tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
When I moved into a property two years ago my mattress had been left in the shed for a "few" days whilst work was done on my room. Instead of receiving a new mattress I got the old one from the previous tenant, plus some new friends - fleas! 
This year, I moved into a property and discovered the old mattress was infested with bed bugs! Thanks previous tenant! 
Whilst it may be expensive to replace mattresses, no tenant should have to live through bug infestations.

attributes.action: Standardise ID requirements for all public and quasi-public bodies
attributes.background: At present any public authority (or quasi public authority such as a utility company or railway) can randomly select what ID requirements are needed from members of the public to interact with them.  Surely this could be standardised for all such institutions through very simple legislation.
attributes.additional_details: For instance some PAs (eg the Bank of England if you want to exchange old bank notes) will accept a driver's licence as proof over address, others (eg my local authority issuing a parking permit) will only accept a utility bill less than 3 months old and not if it is copied from an on-line bill.   NB this is NOT a request for introduction of compulsory ID cards.

attributes.action: £500 tax allowance,every 4 yrs for sport for either membership fee or equipment.
attributes.background: To capitalize on the excitement of the Olympics, every 4 yrs a £500 tax free allowance per person could be allocated to spend on  either sports membership (golf for an example) or sport equipment. This will prevent certain sports being only available to the well off.

attributes.action: Review the exempted conditions and ages for NHS prescription charges
attributes.background:
The list of exempt conditions and age limits have not been reviewed and inequalities now exist.
1. Some life-long life-threatening conditions make sufferers eligible for free prescriptions even when not related to their condition, others receive no support.
2. The age limit of 60 is out of date.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Some of the biggest killers are not currently covered by exemptions such as heart disease. This can mean that people may miss medication to keep them well.
2. The current system encourages those exempt to visit a Dr to obtain prescriptions for minor illnesses when medication is available over the counter. This costs the NHS time and money.
3. As retirement ages increase and people are working longer it is logical that other benefits should remain aligned to the same age.

attributes.action: Ban group interviews for all job applicants in the UK
attributes.background:
In the harsh times we live in, employment and specifically, unemployment is one of the most painful things a person can face.
The indignity of group interviews where people are made to beg around a table for jobs, is unfair.
We need to empower jobseekers, not crush them and ban group interviews.
attributes.additional_details:
Group interviews are by many seen as a lazy recruitment practise, to root out 'unworthy' candidates quickly.
In many cases, I find group interviews to be discriminatory and unfair to certain demographics.
Paid employment is and should be for everyone.
One of the major flaws with group interviews is that introverted personality types are left out in the cold. 
We need to introduce a fairer system that forces employers to evenly and fairly judge ALL potential job candidates.

attributes.action: To ban electronic cigarettes in all public places in England.
attributes.background: They have not been around long enough for scientist to say whether electronic cigarettes cause harm to individuals. Young people are using them as a fashion accessory, not to give up smoking.
attributes.additional_details:
There are a couple of young people in my office at work, who compares the different flavors they have tried and how much they like them.  This is not encouraging them to give up.

There is nothing worse than seeing someone smoking them in a public place, the substance coming out of them is absolutely disgusting.

attributes.action: Remove from doctors working within the NHS the right to strike.
attributes.background: I am a patient with two incurable deteriorating brain conditions. I have waited for six months for three appointments all of which are likely to be cancelled. I have followed the negotiations  closely and have very reluctantly come to the conclusion that the BMA  are being highly irresponsible.
attributes.additional_details:
Three reasons:
1) In May of this year the BMA representative described the new contract as a deal "All sides can sign up to" and that "Doctors can be confident in this new contract". They now say the contract is so bad there have to be massive damaging strikes.
2)There has been a large drop in support for the BMA's militant stance. Of the 54,000 members only a minority 21540 voted to reject the new contract. This is down from 98% at the start of the dispute. A responsible union would re-ballot its members.
3) The BMA have consistently refused to take action such as legal action which would not damage patients and would win their dispute.

attributes.action: Allow workers to continue to sacrifice their salaries in exchange for safer cars
attributes.background: The Daily Mail have reported today that "The Treasury’s proposed rules could come into force next April and would effectively kill off tax benefits worth thousands of pounds a year for company car drivers. Under the plans, workers would be taxed . . ."
attributes.additional_details: Salary sacrifice schemes are the only way some people would ever be able to drive a nice car - you see far fewer "old bangers" on the road nowadays. These schemes must be hugely beneficial to car manufacturers and all associated industries.
